column4: i'm not bent out of shape.. if this place bent me out of shape, i wouldn't come here.
did you use wubi, or did you set up a traditional dual boot?
most likely grub didn't get installed to the MBR for some reason
when this has happened to me in the past.
yup this is exactly what happen
yup, it's become more and more of a problem since manufacturers want to create 5-6 partitions on their drives now
no.. you can just reinstall Ubuntu
for some reason I have 4 partitions on the disc, where I just want two for windows and ubuntu
i dunno, i don't do windows, i can't imagine why Windows would have so many partitions
if I use gparted and partition manually 250 Win7 and 250 Ubuntu and install them seperately will that work?
are you installing win 7 from cd?
but honestly, you don't need to reinstall windows 7 (at least you usually don't)

also, 250gigs for Ubuntu is crazy big.. you might want to short cut a folder that is on your 7 partition, and keep all data there, then just create a more "normal" ubuntu partition, say 15-20gigs.. but.. thats just my opinion
I have a another drive that is 1TB that I use for that
i'm not that familiar with win 7, so i'm always concerned w/ windows running out of space
Yeah, I turn off page file and only use windows for games
